required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 1 Study Of PF-00868554 In Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Positive Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double Blind (3rd Party Open), Placebo-controlled, Sequential Group, Multicentre Study To Evaluate The Multiple Dose Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics And Pharmacodynamics, of PF-00868554 in Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Positive Otherwise Healthy Patient Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: Assess the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of multiple oral doses of PF-00868554 in HCV positive patient volunteers

primary_outcome.time_frame: 0 hours (pre-dose), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12 hours post-dose for twice daily dose; 0 hours (pre-dose), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8 hours post-dose for three times daily dose

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax): Day 1
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0 hours (pre-dose), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12 hours post-dose for twice daily dose; 0 hours (pre-dose), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8 hours post-dose for three times daily dose

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax): Day 8
Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to End of Dosing Interval (AUCtau): Day 1
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0 hours (pre-dose), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12 hours post-dose for twice daily dose; 0 hours (pre-dose), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8 hours post-dose for three times daily dose
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from time zero to end of dosing interval (tau), where dosing interval is 8 hours for three times daily regimens and 12 hours for the twice daily regimens.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to End of Dosing Interval (AUCtau): Day 8
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from time zero to end of dosing interval (tau), where dosing interval is 8 hours for three times daily regimens and 12 hours for the twice daily regimens.

primary_outcome.measure: Minimum Observed Plasma Trough Concentration (Cmin): Day 8
primary_outcome.description: The Cmin of PF-04691502 was assessed following repeated oral dose administration for 8 days (multiple dose PK).

Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half. The t1/2 of PF-04691502 was assessed following repeated oral dose administration for 8 days (multiple dose PK).

primary_outcome.time_frame: 0 hours (pre-dose), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12 hours post-dose on Day 1; 0 hours (pre-dose), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48 hours post-dose on Day 8
primary_outcome.description: Rac was calculated as, area under the curve from time zero to end of dosing interval on Day 8 (AUCtau) divided by area under the curve from time zero to end of dosing interval on Day 1(AUCtau).

primary_outcome.measure: Observed Accumulation Ratio for Cmax (Rac Cmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0 hours (pre-dose), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12 hours post-dose on Day 1; 0 hours (pre-dose), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48 hours post-dose on Day 8
primary_outcome.description: Rac Cmax was calculated as, maximum observed plasma concentration on Day 8 (Cmax) divided by maximum observed plasma concentration on Day 1(Cmax).

primary_outcome.measure: Cumulative Amount of Drug Recovered Unchanged in Urine (Ae): Day 1
primary_outcome.description: Ae is the cumulative amount of drug recovered unchanged in urine during the dosing interval, where the dosing interval is 12 hours. Cumulative amount was calculated as sum of urine drug concentration in sample volume for each collection interval. Sample volume = (urine weight in gram [g]/1.020), where 1.020 g/mL is the approximate specific gravity of urine.

primary_outcome.measure: Cumulative Amount of Drug Recovered Unchanged in Urine (Ae): Day 8
primary_outcome.description: Ae is the cumulative amount of drug recovered unchanged in urine during the dosing interval, where the dosing interval is 12 hours. Cumulative amount was calculated as sum of urine drug concentration in sample volume for each collection interval. Sample volume = (urine weight in gram [g]/1.020), where 1.020 g/mL is the approximate specific gravity of urine.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of Dose Recovered Unchanged in Urine (Ae%): Day 1
primary_outcome.description: Percent of dose recovered unchanged in urine during the dosing interval=100*(cumulative amount of drug recovered unchanged in urine [Ae] divided by dose), where the dosing interval is 12 hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of Dose Recovered Unchanged in Urine (Ae%): Day 8
primary_outcome.description: Percent of dose recovered unchanged in urine during the dosing interval=100 (cumulative amount of drug recovered unchanged in urine [Ae] divided by dose), where the dosing interval is 12 hours.

Renal clearance was calculated as cumulative amount of drug recovered unchanged in urine during the dosing interval (Ae) divided by area under the plasma concentration time-curve from time zero to end of dosing interval (AUCtau), where dosing interval is 12 hours.

Renal clearance was calculated as cumulative amount of drug recovered unchanged in urine during the dosing interval (Ae) divided by area under the plasma concentration time-curve from time zero to end of dosing interval (AUCtau), where dosing interval is 12 hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Ratio of 6 Beta-Hydroxyl Cortisol to Cortisol: Day 1
primary_outcome.description: Urine 6 beta-hydroxyl cortisol and cortisol concentrations were measured using high performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (HPLC-MS/MS).

primary_outcome.measure: Ratio of 6 Beta-Hydroxyl Cortisol to Cortisol: Day 8
primary_outcome.description: Urine 6 beta-hydroxyl cortisol and cortisol concentrations were measured using high performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (HPLC-MS/MS).

primary_outcome.measure: Day 8 to Day 1 Ratio of the 6 Beta-Hydroxyl Cortisol to Cortisol Ratios
primary_outcome.time_frame: -24 to 0 hours (pre-dose) on Day 1 (Day 0); 0 to 24 hours post-dose on Day 8
primary_outcome.description: Urine 6 beta-hydroxyl cortisol and cortisol concentrations were measured using high performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (HPLC-MS/MS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Plasma Log10 Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) Viral Load at Day 8
secondary_outcome.description: HCV RNA levels were determined using the Abbott RealTime HCV polymerase chain reaction (PCR) assay (lower limit of detection [LOD] = 12 international unit per milliliter [IU/mL]). Baseline value calculated as the average of the screening Day 0 and Day 1 pre-dose measurements. The plasma HCV RNA data was log10 transformed, and the change in log10 HCV RNA at Day 8 post-dose from baseline was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) Variants Resistant to PF-00868554

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HCV RNA ≥ 100,000 IU/mL at screening
- Genotype 1a or 1b
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current or prior treatment with IFN and/or RBV
- Evidence of decompensated liver disease

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.description: PF-00868554 100 milligram (mg) powder for oral solution, twice daily on Day 1 through Day 7 and once in morning on Day 8.

outcome.population: Per Protocol (PP) analysis set included all participants who received PF-00868554 and had sufficient plasma concentration data to enable calculation of the pharmacokinetics (PK) parameters.

outcome.title: Plasma Decay Half-Life (t1/2): Day 8
outcome.description: Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half. The t1/2 of PF-04691502 was assessed following repeated oral dose administration for 8 days (multiple dose PK).
outcome.population: PP analysis set included all participants who received PF-00868554 and had sufficient plasma concentration data to enable calculation of the PK parameters. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure.

outcome.title: Observed Accumulation Ratio (Rac)
outcome.description: Rac was calculated as, area under the curve from time zero to end of dosing interval on Day 8 (AUCtau) divided by area under the curve from time zero to end of dosing interval on Day 1(AUCtau).
outcome.time_frame: 0 hours (pre-dose), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12 hours post-dose on Day 1; 0 hours (pre-dose), 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48 hours post-dose on Day 8
outcome.population: PP analysis set included all participants who received PF-00868554 and had sufficient plasma concentration data to enable calculation of the PK parameters.

measure.title: Observed Accumulation Ratio for Cmax (Rac Cmax)
measure.description: Rac Cmax was calculated as, maximum observed plasma concentration on Day 8 (Cmax) divided by maximum observed plasma concentration on Day 1(Cmax).
measure.population: PP analysis set included all participants who received PF-00868554 and had sufficient plasma concentration data to enable calculation of the PK parameters.

outcome.title: Cumulative Amount of Drug Recovered Unchanged in Urine (Ae): Day 1
outcome.description: Ae is the cumulative amount of drug recovered unchanged in urine during the dosing interval, where the dosing interval is 12 hours. Cumulative amount was calculated as sum of urine drug concentration in sample volume for each collection interval. Sample volume = (urine weight in gram [g]/1.020), where 1.020 g/mL is the approximate specific gravity of urine.
outcome.population: PP analysis set included all participants who received PF-00868554 and had sufficient plasma concentration data to enable calculation of the PK parameters. Urine collection interval was 12 hours and not 8 hours; therefore, urinary PK parameters were not calculated for three times daily regimens.

group.description: PF-00868554 450 mg powder for oral solution, twice daily on Day 1 through Day 7 and once in morning on Day 8.

measure.title: Percent of Dose Recovered Unchanged in Urine (Ae%): Day 1
measure.description: Percent of dose recovered unchanged in urine during the dosing interval=100*(cumulative amount of drug recovered unchanged in urine [Ae] divided by dose), where the dosing interval is 12 hours.
measure.population: PP analysis set included all participants who received PF-00868554 and had sufficient plasma concentration data to enable calculation of the PK parameters. Urine collection interval was 12 hours and not 8 hours; therefore, urinary PK parameters were not calculated for three times daily regimens.

outcome.title: Percent of Dose Recovered Unchanged in Urine (Ae%): Day 8
outcome.description: Percent of dose recovered unchanged in urine during the dosing interval=100 (cumulative amount of drug recovered unchanged in urine [Ae] divided by dose), where the dosing interval is 12 hours.
outcome.population: PP analysis set included all participants who received PF-00868554 and had sufficient plasma concentration data to enable calculation of the PK parameters. Urine collection interval was 12 hours and not 8 hours; therefore, urinary PK parameters were not calculated for three times daily regimens.

group.title: PF-00868554 100 mg Twice Daily
group.description: PF-00868554 100 milligram (mg) powder for oral solution, twice daily on Day 1 through Day 7 and once in morning on Day 8.

group.title: PF-00868554 300 mg Twice Daily
group.description: PF-00868554 300 mg powder for oral solution, twice daily on Day 1 through Day 7 and once in morning on Day 8.

group.title: PF-00868554 450 mg Twice Daily
group.description: PF-00868554 450 mg powder for oral solution, twice daily on Day 1 through Day 7 and once in morning on Day 8.

measure.title: Percent of Dose Recovered Unchanged in Urine (Ae%): Day 8
measure.description: Percent of dose recovered unchanged in urine during the dosing interval=100 (cumulative amount of drug recovered unchanged in urine [Ae] divided by dose), where the dosing interval is 12 hours.
measure.population: PP analysis set included all participants who received PF-00868554 and had sufficient plasma concentration data to enable calculation of the PK parameters. Urine collection interval was 12 hours and not 8 hours; therefore, urinary PK parameters were not calculated for three times daily regimens.

outcome.title: Renal Clearance (CLr): Day 1
outcome.description: Renal clearance was calculated as cumulative amount of drug recovered unchanged in urine during the dosing interval (Ae) divided by area under the plasma concentration time-curve from time zero to end of dosing interval (AUCtau), where dosing interval is 12 hours.
outcome.population: PP analysis set included all participants who received PF-00868554 and had sufficient plasma concentration data to enable calculation of the PK parameters. Urine collection interval was 12 hours and not 8 hours; therefore, urinary PK parameters were not calculated for three times daily regimens.

outcome.title: Ratio of 6 Beta-Hydroxyl Cortisol to Cortisol: Day 1
outcome.description: Urine 6 beta-hydroxyl cortisol and cortisol concentrations were measured using high performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (HPLC-MS/MS).
outcome.population: PP analysis set included all participants who received PF-00868554 and had sufficient plasma concentration data to enable calculation of the PK parameters.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Plasma Log10 Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) Viral Load at Day 8
outcome.description: HCV RNA levels were determined using the Abbott RealTime HCV polymerase chain reaction (PCR) assay (lower limit of detection [LOD] = 12 international unit per milliliter [IU/mL]). Baseline value calculated as the average of the screening Day 0 and Day 1 pre-dose measurements. The plasma HCV RNA data was log10 transformed, and the change in log10 HCV RNA at Day 8 post-dose from baseline was calculated.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) Variants Resistant to PF-00868554
outcome.population: FAS included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Designation of outcomes as primary, secondary based on team’s input. Results for relationship analyses of baseline susceptibility to PF-00868554 and/or non-structural 5B genotype and change in HCV RNA was not done, as per change in planned analysis.
